intro: Clidemia ventricosa, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, glossy green leaves and clusters of small, orange-red flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has a succulent, fleshy stem and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees. Clidemia ventricosa is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
